package com.example.smartirrigation

import android.os.Bundle
import androidx.activity.enableEdgeToEdge
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
import androidx.core.view.ViewCompat
import androidx.core.view.WindowInsetsCompat

class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {2
 override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
 super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
 enableEdgeToEdge()
 setContentView(R.layout.activity_main)
 ViewCompat.setOnApplyWindowInsetsListener(findViewById(R.id.main)) { v, insets ->
 val systemBars = insets.getInsets(WindowInsetsCompat.Type.systemBars())
 v.setPadding(systemBars.left, systemBars.top, systemBars.right, systemBars.bottom)
 insets
 }
 }
}
```
</current_file>

crop_name,category,soil_type,base_water_mm_per_season,adjusted_water_mm_per_season,irrigation_frequency_multiplier,source.

Create a Java model class CropWaterRequirement in package com.example.smartirrigation with fields matching those columns, proper getters/setters, and a toString() that returns crop_name + " - " + soil_type.

Create a helper class CsvDataLoader in the same package with a static method
public static List<CropWaterRequirement> loadData(Context context)
that:

Opens R.raw.smart_irrigation_crop_soil_dataset as an InputStream

Uses BufferedReader to read line by line

Skips the header line

Splits on comma (simple split(",") is fine)

Parses numeric fields into double

Returns a List<CropWaterRequirement>.

Add basic null / error handling: catch exceptions, log them with Log.e and return an empty list if something fails.
